abstract: Bear Stearns chief executive Alan Schwartz and JPMorgan Chase chief executive James Dimon are among the witnesses expected to appear on Capitol Hill on Thursday for what Chris Dodd, chairman of the Senate Banking Committee, said he hopes will be a “full, thorough airing of the relevant facts and information” about the Fed-backed fire sale of Bear to JPMorgan.
lead_paragraph: Bear Stearns chief executive Alan Schwartz and JPMorgan Chase chief executive James Dimon are among the witnesses expected to appear on Capitol Hill on Thursday for what Chris Dodd, chairman of the Senate Banking Committee, said he hopes will be a “full, thorough airing of the relevant facts and information” about the Fed-backed fire sale of Bear to JPMorgan.

headline.main: Senators to Question Chiefs of Bear and JPMorgan

abstract: CNBC coverage of Senate testimony by Ben S. Bernanke on the role of the Fed in helping guide the merger between Bear Stearns and JPMorgan.

lead_paragraph: CNBC coverage of Senate testimony by Ben S. Bernanke on the role of the Fed in helping guide the merger between Bear Stearns and JPMorgan.

headline.main: Bernanke on Fed Role in Bear Deal

abstract: James Dimon wants Washington to know that his firm did not use the Federal Reserve as a dumping ground for Bear Stearns‘ shakiest pieces.
lead_paragraph: James Dimon wants Washington to know that his firm did not use the Federal Reserve as a dumping ground for Bear Stearns‘ shakiest pieces.

headline.main: Dimon Says JPMorgan Didn’t ‘Cherry Pick’ Bear Assets
